conclusion: Understanding the problem involves analyzing v-t graphs of objects A and B.
Explanation of what a velocity-time graph represents and how slope relates to acceleration.
The graph shows two curves for objects A and B.
Object A's velocity increases steadily from time 0 to \( t_2 \), indicating constant positive acceleration.
At time \( t_2 \), object A's velocity increases at a slightly faster rate.
Object B's velocity is the same as object A at time 0.
From time 0 to approximately \( t_1 \), object B's velocity decreases to a minimum and then starts increasing.
At time \( t_2 \), object B's velocity is less than that of object A.
To analyze object B's acceleration, examine the slope of its velocity curve.
From time 0 to \( t_{\text{min}} \), object B's velocity decreases, indicating negative acceleration.
From \( t_{\text{min}} \) to \( t_2 \), object B's velocity increases, indicating positive acceleration.
During the interval from 0 to \( t_2 \), object B's acceleration changes from negative to positive.
The trend of object B's acceleration is from negative to positive.
Consideration of the magnitude of acceleration and slope of the v-t graph.
